reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed a winter Saturday night and had a reduced rate for their cheapest room (around £100) through their website, a good reduction on their standard rates. Great location on the Cathedral green, and right next to all the shops and a short walk to the attractive river-front area. Staff welcoming and efficient, gave me clear directions to the nearby local off-street car park for my car, charged at a reasonable £9 per 24 hours. The one downside was that our room was pretty small, although functional, and rather noisy in the evening. Fairly tiny bathroom, with shower, mini-washbasin and no shelves of any kind to put things on! One chair in the room, and a standard size double bed, which did prove very comfortable. Unfortunately our room overlooked a pedestrian passageway next to the hotel, opposite a pub and there was loud music until around midnight. The problems with the room didn't deter us for a night's stay, but might get wearing if we had stayed longer. We managed to book in the famous restaurant run by the Michelin-starred chef, Michael Caines, for a reduced-rate early evening dinner; about half the price of the standard menu, smaller portions of terrific food, lovely staff and excellent house wines. Again, the staff were lovely, and the restaurant quiet that early in the evening. Great breakfast the following morning, the cold breakfast included lots of different fresh fruits, fresh orange juice etc. We really didn't need to sample the hot dishes! This hotel has been there for years and years, (was the Royal Clarence) and I was pleased to see that some of the original features remain, such as bits of leaded stained glass. And, if you don't eat in the restaurant, there is a bistro in the hotel too for informal dining. So we would go back provided the price for the room is reasonable, the experience was well worth it, and, for us, the service excellent.
reviews.title: Great location, good for a weekend, but your room might be rather small!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Abode - we have stayed many times and always been very happy with the service we've received! Our stay once again was very enjoyable, especially our fine dining in the Michael Caine restaurant - the staff were very attentive and professional, and the food was a delight, just wonderful! We are sad to say we didn't receive the same experience in the Cafe bar on our second night (17th Feb) - we had booked a table for 7.30 and asked specifically when booking if we could have the window table, we were told yes that is booked for you - when we arrived the table was occupied and we were informed by the cafe bar manager that they had been there since 5pm and were still drinking - we said he should have informed them that the table was booked out at 7.30 - he said he would try to get them moved to another table - when this had still not occured after 20 minutes, we said we would stay at the table he had given us initially - all very dissapointing and unprofessional - he was quite rude whilst telling us it wasn't his fault!!! On hearing what had happened to us, another couple came over to us and said they had received similar treatment when booking a table there, and not been given the table they had asked for - in advance! Thank goodness the food once again was wonderful - the same cannot be said for the cafe bar manager on duty!!
reviews.title: Relaxing Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: I was in Exeter for an event for one night and had a Hotels.com voucher to use. As the voucher was for £100 I decided I could afford to treat myself. The cost for a 'comfortable' room was £145 and this did not include breakfast. I therefore felt that the room would have been more luxorious than it turned out to be. Don't get me wrong, it had everything that you would expect from a high-end hotel; the mattress was lovely. It felt a little too soft at first, but once in bed, was perfect. The linens were good but the towels were rather 'thin' and, dare I say it, a bit grey. There was a tea tray with the usual suspects, an ironing board and iron, which was useful, and a hairdryer. All fine. The room was warm but I was surprised that there was no central heating radiator, just a small, free-standing, oil filled heater. I didn't need it but if I had, I wouldn't have wanted one that I had to turn off and on myself, not at the price they were charging. The room was small. I was on my own so it didn't matter too much but if I'd been sharing, it would have been tight. The shower room was also small although the shower itself was decent. But the basin was so small and the shelf above positioned in such a way that it made rinsing your mouth after tooth-brushing, awkward. I expected some street noise, this is a city centre hotel, after all. I didn't mind that and the secondary glazing blocked most of it. In fact, the city quietened down much earlier than I'd expected, around midnight. The main problem was the light from the shop opposite which was so bright that even with the curtains closed, the room was almost as light as it would be during daylight. The rooms need blackout blinds as well as curtains. The staff were pleasant and the ambience of the hotel high-end. But I didn't think the room I had was value for money.
reviews.title: Not sure the room justified the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: weve stayed here before its a great hotel.good service close to everything in town,the staff are alawys helpfull and friendly would highly recomm
reviews.title: good service hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: end it. beds are very comfortable and room has everything you need in it.
reviews.title: Lovely Accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night in midweek, late Feb. Great location (opposite the lovely cathedral, near the shops), nice bar (but order your drinks when you check in as it takes about 20 minutes to get them), very good Abode/Michael Caine restaurant (my wife said her chocolate ice cream medley was the best she'd ever tasted, and she's eaten a lot of chocolate ice cream). So, all good.
reviews.title: Really nice hotel but could be even better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The let-down was the room. We were put in 217 (I think) which was supposed to be a superior and was nicely decorated (but quite cramped, which is probably fair enough for an old hotel trying to fit in all the mod-cons), but it was right next to what we were told was the kitchen heat extractors(??). The noise was pretty awful. We went downstairs after we'd checked in and asked if the extractors made that racket all night and were told they didn't as they were switched off when the kitchen staff went home. It turned out that they weren't, as we spent the night in a pleasant room with a noise adjacent to it that was like a small aircraft taking off, which wasn't an aid to a restful night's sleep.
reviews.title: Flawless !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, pretty good but choose your room carefully.
reviews.title: Perfect location, great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd give it a 3.5, with the potential to go to 4.5.
reviews.title: Great location, very clean, friendly, comfortable bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second visit to the Royal Clarence for lunch but this time to celebrate a special birthday and we were not disappointed. The staff here are incredibly friendly, polite , professional and helpful ... a real breath of fresh air in these days of lacklustre and mediocre customer care.
reviews.title: Just awesome!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Good location, next to the cathedral, which is spectacular. Near the main high street, lots of local cafes, shops nearby. Bit of a maze inside to find your room, but once there rooms are fine, bed was very comfortable. Bathroom OK, shower OK (fixed head only), but very weak toilet flush....basically it didn't flush! Hotel really needs to sort that out. Basic rooms have no fridge or drinking water so bring your own, Tesco only one minute away. Very helpful and attentive staff, excellent in all respects.
reviews.title: Good location for Exeter hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A 40th anniversary is a special occasion by anybodys standard...a room booked at the hotel, a dinner reservation in the restaurant....oh dear! we do not expect grime and mould on the shower grouting, we do not expect a freestanding mirror propped against the wall, we do not expect loose hanging ends on a curtain.....sloppy housekeeping.
reviews.title: lots of hype but lacks substance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The restaurant.....fish with meat products mixed, tough vegetables, wrong wine brought to the table, staff were polite but badly trained with little knowledge of their food and wine, ...
reviews.title: Lovely hotel by the cathedral

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast..soggy toast, coffee delivered to the table but the waitress forgot the tea, a buffet of low standard..in all fairness, the scrambled eggs with smoked salmon were very good but any hotel should be able to produce service and good food at the simplest meal of the day.
reviews.title: Review for restaurant & hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: Having spent many years living out of a suitcase in many diverse countries AND been wined and dined in lesser establishments I would , not unreasonably, expected better.
reviews.title: Birthday meal in tears !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went away for a 2 night quiet weekend stay in Exeter just after Valentines Day and stayed at ABode. The hotel itself has a nice decor with friendly staff. The first night was spent in room 101. The room itself was nice enough, although smelt a little musty on arrival. There was a function downstairs until around 1130pm which didn't bother us too much but throughout the night there was a noisy air conditioner or fan extractor unit outside that kept starting up and whirring away throughout the night. The secondary glazing wasn't successful at keep this noise at bay unfortunately.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, noisy rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was also a dripping noise (that I couldn't locate, and probably explains the musty smell) which made for a fairly sleepless night. We asked at reception to be relocated and they obliged. We were offered two other rooms, the first of which also seemed to have an air extraction thing outside as well, so we picked the other overlooking a pub in an alley way next to the hotel. This room was quieter than both the others and we got a better night sleep here!
reviews.title: A very good standard city centre hotel, but the air con can be troublesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Generally the hotel is nice, and the rooms are well decorated and comfortable with good bathrooms+showers, although a little on the small side (a victim of being an old hotel I think)
reviews.title: Comfortable stay, lovely food, friendly staff, fantastic wine bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Great location, in the heart of the City, directly opposite the cathedral.
reviews.title: A bit tired in parts but the service more than makes up for it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our rooom had a six foot wide bed, wonderful linen and pillows and a v modern bathroom. We had a view of the cathedral. As well as the cafe, there is a serious restaurant on the ground floor, even if the breakfast left something to be desired.
reviews.title: Lovely Setting
